newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan's Formosa Taffeta to raise China investment.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan's Formosa Taffeta to raise China investment.

text.p: Taiwan's Formosa Taffeta, a unit of Formosa Plastics group, said on Tuesday it planned to increase investments in China to US$176 million from the current US$75.9 million.
"We plan to merge our three plants in Chungshan (southern China) and increase our investment amount to US$176 million," Formosa Taffeta spokesman Lai Wu-lang told Reuters.
Lai said the merger was expected to boost the efficiency and coordination of the three plants.
The plants -- an umbrella factory, a textile plant and a chemical fibre plant -- registered combined sales revenues of T$800 million in 1996, company officials said.
Lai said the company also planned to set up four gas stations in Taiwan in 1997.
Formosa Taffeta has set a 1997 pre-tax profit of T$2.02 billion on sales of T$15.5 billion.
